attributes.action: request DEFRA not to allow the EU import of GM SOYBEANS  for use in animal feed. Polls have shown that over 90% of the British public do not want GM PRODUCTS.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
New GM feed looks for authorisation this week
News 1 December, 2008 

By William Surman 
A NEW genetically modified soybean could be authorized for import into the European Union this week in a move that could see livestock feed prices drop.

Given that soybean meal is the primary source of protein for EU animal feed, farmers will hope for approval to ease current cost pressures. 

The GM soybean, developed by Monsanto and known commercially as Roundup Ready 2, is grown across the world but has not yet received the green light to enter the EU food chain. 

It is thought the European Commission will come to a decision on Friday (December 5), after agriculture ministers failed to reach agreement on the product last month.
